alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer; Morris; Somerset; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hunterdon, southwestern Morris, southeastern Warren, northwestern Mercer, western Somerset and central Bucks Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sand Brook, or 16 miles west of Somerville, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgewater, Ewing, Byram, Washington, Mendham, Flemington, High Bridge, Clinton, Pennington, Peapack And Gladstone, New Hope, Oxford, Hopewell, Glen Gardner, Chester, Hampton, Frenchtown, Lebanon, Califon and Far Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 31. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 74 and 76. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 20 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central, northern and northwestern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
